title: Inside Shein's sweatshops in Guangzhou: 'It's an extreme capitalist race'
summary: Le Monde visited several workshops producing millions of garments for the Chinese fast fashion giant. Employees and managers spoke about the harsh reality of an ultra-competitive system.

title: Zelensky open to talks with Russia if Putin agrees to ceasefire starting Monday
summary: Kyiv said it will meet Moscow in Istanbul on May 15 only if Russia stops its offensive from May 12.

title: Another Newark airport disruption as Trump's transportation secretary talks of reducing flights
summary: In addition to equipment outages, the airport has been beset by flight delays and cancellations brought on by a shortage of air traffic controllers. Infrastructure issues are increasingly a key concern at airports around the country.

title: 'Tekiya' kitchens in Gaza: The last bulwark against famine nears collapse
summary: A vital lifeline for hundreds of thousands of Gaza residents, these soup kitchens are under threat from the renewed devastation of military operations and Israel's blockade of humanitarian aid since March 2.

title: US-Israeli hostage's family says Edan Alexander will be released from Gaza 'in the coming days'
summary: Hamas said it would release a US-Israeli hostage held in Gaza as the group revealed it was engaged in direct talks with the United States towards a ceasefire in the war-battered territory.

title: How a piece of André Breton's studio moved from Paris to Metz
summary: It took 20 days to transfer 255 objects from André Breton's studio from Beaubourg in Paris to the Centre Pompidou-Metz near the German border. The collection has been on display since May 8 in an exhibition curated by the artist Maurizio Cattelan.

title: Qatar says no final decision made on gifting Trump a jet to use as Air Force One
summary: The US Constitution's Emoluments Clause bars anyone holding government office from accepting any present, emolument, office or title from any 'King, Prince, or foreign State,' without congressional consent.

title: 'Macron and his prime minister clash over two conceptions of the referendum as a political tool'
summary: While Prime Minister François Bayrou considers using referendums to deal with France's public finances, President Emmanuel Macron envisages a less dramatic use of this tool, writes Le Monde politicial columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Trump announces an executive order to align some US prescription prices with other nations
summary: The order Trump is promising will direct the Department of Health and Human Services to tie what Medicare pays for medications administered in a doctor's office to the lowest price paid by other countries. His proposal would likely only impact certain drugs covered by Medicare and given in an office.

title: Poland accuses Russian intelligence services for 2024 fire in Warsaw
summary: Since Russia's February 2022 offensive against Ukraine, Poland – a loyal ally of Kyiv – claims to be the target of sabotage attempts, which they blame on Russia.

title: Iran, US wrap up 'difficult but useful' fourth round of nuclear talks
summary: The latest round of talks in Oman ended with Tehran and Washington still deadlocked over Iran's uranium enrichment, yet both parties reported progress and pledged to reconvene soon.

title: The magpie is indeed a thief, but also scared of new things
summary: A Norwegian experiment suggests that the presence of unexpected materials in nests, such as plastic or metal, could act as a scarecrow for corvids.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear your convictions on the red carpet?
summary: In fashion as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: The foretold disaster of Israel's plan for humanitarian aid in Gaza
summary: Israel plans to entrust food deliveries to private security companies to prevent Hamas from diverting shipments. Industry professionals are concerned about the risk of militarizing aid and exacerbating inequalities.

title: Pope Leo XIV 's first Sunday prayer hints at shift from Francis on war in Ukraine
summary: The new pope called for a 'genuine, just and lasting peace' between Kyiv and Moscow on Sunday. Francis had more often urged immediate peace and asked Ukraine to show 'the courage of the white flag.'

title: During Paris neo-fascist march: 'How can such things be allowed?'
summary: Initially banned by the police before being authorized by the administrative court, the march unfolded in a tense atmosphere in the Montparnasse neighborhood, under the protection of riot police.

title: After the ceasefire, lessons from the worst India-Pakistan clash in 20 years
summary: At the urging of the Americans, the two belligerents agreed to cease hostilities on Saturday, May 10. However, gunfire and explosions continued along the borderline in Kashmir.

title: Should screens be banned for 6-year-olds? Even if this seems 'unrealistic,' there are 'protective factors'
summary: Some healthcare professionals recommend banning screens for children under 6 years old. Psychiatrist Serge Tisseron acknowledges in an op-ed for Le Monde that strict prohibition may seem difficult to implement but suggests some precautions that, in his view, could limit the risks of screentime.

title: Nigeria: At least 23 killed in attacks in Benue State
summary: With many herders belonging to the Muslim Fulani ethnic group, and many farmers Christian, the attacks in Nigeria's so-called Middle Belt often take on a religious or ethnic dimension.

title: Steven Spielberg, guardian of Holocaust memory
summary: The American director set out in the 1990s to collect testimonies from all Holocaust survivors. To date, the foundation he created for this purpose has gathered over 56,000 testimonies worldwide.
